question: 郵便番号
sourceMnemonic: You know that a <ja>郵便</ja> is the <kanji>mail</kanji> and that a <ja>番号</ja> is a <kanji>number</kanji>. So a "mail number," what is that? Usually refers to your <vocabulary>post number</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>postal code</vocabulary>. It is also often referred to with a symbol, which is <ja>〒</ja>, so look out for that.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
